data.title: The Purple Chakra Meaning and Colors - Crown Chakra
data.meta_description: What is Sahasrara the purple chakra meaning, role in the chakra system, our health, spiritual growth, development? And what about the color?
data.meta_site_name: Asana at Home Online Yoga Inc.
data.text:
At the base of the spine, the first chakra is Muladhara, the root chakra, which is associated with the color red and represents our sense of grounding and security.

Then, moving up the body, we have the second chakra, Svadhishthana, the sacral chakra, which is associated with the color orange and represents our creativity and sexual energy.

Next is Manipura chakra, the solar plexus chakra, which is associated with the color yellow and represents our power and confidence.

Following is the fourth chakra, Anahata. The Anahata, or heart chakra, is located in the center of the chest and is associated with the color green. It represents our ability to love and connect with others.

Meditation is one of the most effective ways to activate and balance the chakras, including Sahasrara, crown chakra, the purple chakra meaning.

First, Sit in a quiet, comfortable place and focus your attention on the top of your head. Next, imagine a beam of white or light purple light flowing into your body from the crown of your head, filling your entire being with a sense of peace and connection to the divine.

Lastly, visualize a lotus flower with a thousand petals at the top of your head, slowly opening up to reveal the universeâ€™s infinite nature.
